content.description:
This route would be 4 star if it were only a bit longer! It has fun climbing from bottom to top.

Start on the left side of the arete (1st bolt), move to the right (2nd bolt), up steep ground as you weave back around left (3rd bolt & crux) to a couple exciting tugs and the chains.

There are several quality 5.11s on the cliff, and this should be on your list!
content.location: This ascends the obvious, short, overhanging arete on the far right side of Greg's Cliff.

content.description: Move up to a small ledge and clip the first bolt.  Continue up into the meat of the crux via several clips on the unique brown face.  A few more clips through somewhat overhanging rock and you are at the anchor ledge, which sports clipping hooks.  The route is rated 5.9, but I added a plus as I think it is on the stiffer side of the grade.  YMMV.
content.protection: Five bolts to double bolt anchor.
content.location:
From the approach trail, walk past

Baba Fats

on the left side of the cliff and head for the center/right wall of Greg's Cliff.  This area has multiple routes within a short distance.  Locate the obvious, vertical, chocolate brown face with bolts, which is Truth Decay.

climbs.name: This Way or That
climbs.fa: B. D'Antonio, F. Fierst & V. Kodas

content.description:
Start under the small roof with a bolt just above it.  The next moves are the crux, which will feel easier with a good reach and dyno skills but harder without.  Move up left then right, surmount a super fun second overhang and traverse right to

Truth Decay's

anchors.  Lots of fun with nice variety.
content.protection:
Six bolts to

Truth Decay's

anchors.
content.location:
From the approach trail, walk past

Baba Fats

on the left side of the cliff and head for the center/right wall of Greg's Cliff. This area has multiple routes within a short distance. Locate

Truth Decay's

obvious, vertical, chocolate brown face with bolts.  Immediately left is This Way or That.

climbs.name: Slippery Slope
climbs.fa: B. D'Antonio, F. Fierst, V. Kodas, 2003

content.description: A hard start leads to a good rest and fun, steep, jug hauling to the top.  This shares anchors with 'Bolts and a Pin'.
content.location:
This is the 3rd bolted route from the right of Greg's Cliff, 5 feet left of

Bolts and a Pin

.

content.description:
One route right of Baba Fats, One Leg's Shorter climbs up a steep dihedral. The start is pretty juggy, but the jugs soon give way to slopy weirdness. This makes the second clip a bit exciting. Consider pre-hanging the second draw.

Steep, interesting climbing continues up the dihedral to the chains.

No Guts, No Glory is great, overhanging climbing on perfect rock with dynamic movement. Good holds, finger locks, abundant great feet, and a satisfying throw for the final jug make this super fun! Look for hidden undercling start! There are hangers at the top.
content.location:
Just to the right of

One Leg's Shorter

, scramble up to the first bolt (a stickclip can be nice for the first two bolts). Your belayer may want to be at the bottom of the cliff.

content.description: Climb a roof protected by a piton [the piton was missing].
content.protection:
3 bolts, 1 (it was missing) piton (now replaced with a bolt), and chains.

Per

Colter

: the climb has been rebolted.
content.location:
This is the 2nd route from the right on Greg's Cliff.  This shares anchors with

Slippery Slope

.

content.description:
Baba Fats is on the left side of Greg's Cliff. The approach trail will drop you right in front of the route.

A classic route! Although there are rests, the route is deceptively overhanging and strenuous. Follow the black streak in the rock, starting at a small, slabby section. The climbing is primarily face climbing on horizontal holds. The crux is a long, strenuous section in the middle of the route.

climbs.name: A Broad's Side Of A Barn Door

content.description: This has a hard, core intensive crux.  It is really worth doing.
content.location: Start at the apex of the left and right side of Greg's Cliff.  Climb up and right to a roof then moves back left.

content.description: The crux is found just past the final bolt.  A great hand hold is easily missed for the strong lunge to the anchors.
content.location:
This is located to the right of

Truth Decay

(~10 feet or so).  It climbs along a narrow, dihedral gap.
